title: Welcome to evanverse
text: evanverse lightweight, modular R toolkit designed assist everyday development workflow â€” functions simple, practical, elegant. Whether â€™re installing packages, building logical filters, writing expressive scripts, evanverse offers convenience functions just work.

title: Welcome to evanverse
code: # Recommended installation via GitHub install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("evanbio/evanverse")

previous_headings: ğŸ”§ Core Functions at a Glance
title: Welcome to evanverse
code: "Good" %p% "morning" #> [1] "Good morning" #> [1] "Good morning"

previous_headings: ğŸ”§ Core Functions at a Glance
what: combine_logic() â€” Combine logical vectors in parallel
title: Welcome to evanverse
code: combine_logic(c(TRUE, FALSE), c(TRUE, TRUE)) #> [1]  TRUE FALSE #> [1] TRUE FALSE

title: Welcome to evanverse
text: ğŸ“„ README GitHub ğŸŒ Documentation site (coming soon) â” View functions: ?evanverse help(package = "evanverse")

what: ğŸ’¬ A note from the author
title: Welcome to evanverse
text: â€™re building verse R â€” let toolkit help move faster, smoother, little happier along way. â€”â€” Evan Zhou

what: ğŸ“¦ Manage Your R Packages with Style
title: Managing R Packages with evanverse
text: evanverse provides streamlined utility functions installing, checking, updating R packages â€” including support CRAN, Bioconductor, GitHub. vignette walks : inst_pkg() â€” install packages source check_pkg() â€” check package installed update_pkg() â€” update packages smartly

title: Managing R Packages with evanverse
code: # Install a single CRAN package inst_pkg("dplyr", source = "CRAN")  # Install from GitHub inst_pkg("evanbio/evanverse", source = "GitHub")  # Install Bioconductor packages inst_pkg("edgeR", source = "Bioconductor")

what: ğŸ” Check Package Availability â€” check_pkg()
title: Managing R Packages with evanverse
code: check_pkg("ggplot2")    # TRUE check_pkg("notapkg")    # FALSE

title: Managing R Packages with evanverse
code: # Update CRAN and Bioconductor packages update_pkg()  # Update GitHub packages only update_pkg(pkg = c("evanbio/evanverse", "rstudio/gt"), source = "GitHub")  # Update specific Bioconductor package update_pkg(pkg = "limma", source = "Bioconductor")

title: Managing R Packages with evanverse
text: Managing packages across CRAN, Bioconductor, GitHub doesnâ€™t need pain. evanverse, can keep environment tidy --date â€” just consistent commands.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Evan Zhou. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zhou E (2025). evanverse: Evan's R Universe Tools Creativity. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/evanbio/evanverse.
code: @Manual{,   title = {evanverse: Evan's R Universe of Tools and Creativity},   author = {Evan Zhou},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/evanbio/evanverse}, }

title: evanverse
text: evanverse modular lightweight R package Evan Zhou. provides flexible expressive toolkit daily R development, including data processing, scripting, reproducible analysis workflows.

title: evanverse
text: ğŸ“¦ Modular structure focus clarity reusability ğŸ› ï¸ Practical utilities package handling, logic, workflow automation âœ¨ Minimal, expressive, extensible design

title: evanverse
text: can install development version evanverse GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") # devtools::install_github("evanbio/evanverse")

title: evanverse
code: library(evanverse)  # Example: "Hello" %p% "world"

title: evanverse
text: evanverse currently provides following utility functions: check_pkg() â€” check packages installed inst_pkg() â€” install packages CRAN, GitHub, Bioconductor update_pkg() â€” update packages source %p% â€” paste two strings space %% â€” strict identity comparison combine_logic() â€” combine multiple logical vectors hex2rgb() â€” convert HEX RGB rgb2hex() â€” convert RGB HEX plot_venn() â€” draw 2â€“4 set Venn diagrams with_timer() â€” wrap time function remind() â€” show helpful R usage tips

title: evanverse
text: Full documentation vignettes available : ğŸ‘‰ https://evanbio.github.io/evanverse/

title: evanverse
text: project active development currently designed personal use. Feedback pull requests welcome future versions.

title: evanverse
text: MIT License Â© 2025 Evan Zhou

what: ğŸ” any_void(): Check if Any Value is Void (NA / NULL /
title: ğŸ” any_void(): Check if Any Value is Void (NA / NULL /
text: Test whether element vector list considered "void". Void values include NA, NULL, empty strings (""), can customize ones consider.

title: ğŸ” any_void(): Check if Any Value is Void (NA / NULL /
code: any_void(x, include_na = TRUE, include_null = TRUE, include_empty_str = TRUE)

title: ğŸ” any_void(): Check if Any Value is Void (NA / NULL /
text: x vector list. include_na Logical. Consider NA void. Default: TRUE. include_null Logical. Consider NULL void. Default: TRUE. include_empty_str Logical. Consider "" void. Default: TRUE.

title: ğŸ” any_void(): Check if Any Value is Void (NA / NULL /
text: Logical. TRUE void values present, FALSE otherwise.

title: ğŸ” any_void(): Check if Any Value is Void (NA / NULL /
code: any_void(c("a", "", NA))               # TRUE #> [1] TRUE any_void(list("x", NULL, "y"))         # TRUE #> [1] TRUE any_void(c("a", "b", "c"))             # FALSE #> [1] FALSE any_void(NULL)                         # TRUE #> [1] TRUE any_void("", include_empty_str = FALSE)  # FALSE #> [1] FALSE

what: ğŸŒˆ bio_palette_gallery(): Visualize All Palettes in a Gallery View â€” bio_palette_gallery
title: ğŸŒˆ bio_palette_gallery(): Visualize All Palettes in a Gallery View â€” bio_palette_gallery
text: Display palettes compiled RDS paged gallery format.

title: ğŸŒˆ bio_palette_gallery(): Visualize All Palettes in a Gallery View â€” bio_palette_gallery
code: bio_palette_gallery(   palette_rds = "data/palettes.rds",   type = c("sequential", "diverging", "qualitative"),   max_palettes = 30,   max_row = 12,   verbose = TRUE )

title: ğŸŒˆ bio_palette_gallery(): Visualize All Palettes in a Gallery View â€” bio_palette_gallery
text: palette_rds Path compiled RDS (default: "data/palettes.rds") type Palette types include: "sequential", "diverging", "qualitative" max_palettes Number palettes per page (default: 30) max_row Max colors per row (default: 12) verbose Whether print summary/logs (default: TRUE)

title: ğŸŒˆ bio_palette_gallery(): Visualize All Palettes in a Gallery View â€” bio_palette_gallery
text: named list ggplot objects (one per page)

what: âœ… Check if packages are installed and optionally install them â€” check_pkg
title: âœ… Check if packages are installed and optionally install them â€” check_pkg
text: utility check whether CRAN / GitHub / Bioconductor packages installed, optional auto-installation via inst_pkg().

title: âœ… Check if packages are installed and optionally install them â€” check_pkg
code: check_pkg(   pkg = NULL,   source = c("CRAN", "GitHub", "Bioconductor"),   auto_install = TRUE,   ... )

title: âœ… Check if packages are installed and optionally install them â€” check_pkg
text: pkg Character vector package names GitHub repos (e.g., "r-lib/devtools"). source Package source: one "CRAN", "GitHub", "Bioconductor". Case-insensitive. auto_install Logical. TRUE (default), install missing packages automatically. ... Additional arguments passed inst_pkg().

title: âœ… Check if packages are installed and optionally install them â€” check_pkg
text: tibble columns: package, name, installed, source.

title: âœ… Check if packages are installed and optionally install them â€” check_pkg
code: check_pkg("ggplot2", source = "CRAN") #> âœ” Installed: ggplot2 #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 4 #>   package name    installed source #>   <chr>   <chr>   <lgl>     <chr>  #> 1 ggplot2 ggplot2 TRUE      CRAN   check_pkg("r-lib/devtools", source = "GitHub", auto_install = FALSE) #> âœ” Installed: devtools #> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 4 #>   package        name     installed source #>   <chr>          <chr>    <lgl>     <chr>  #> 1 r-lib/devtools devtools TRUE      GitHub

what: ğŸ§­ cols_with_void(): Detect Columns Containing Void Values â€” cols_with_void
title: ğŸ§­ cols_with_void(): Detect Columns Containing Void Values â€” cols_with_void
text: Scan data.frame tibble identify columns contain "void" values. Void values include NA, NULL, "", can toggled via parameters.

title: ğŸ§­ cols_with_void(): Detect Columns Containing Void Values â€” cols_with_void
code: cols_with_void(   data,   include_na = TRUE,   include_null = TRUE,   include_empty_str = TRUE,   return_names = TRUE )

title: ğŸ§­ cols_with_void(): Detect Columns Containing Void Values â€” cols_with_void
text: data data.frame tibble. include_na Logical. Detect NA TRUE. Default: TRUE. include_null Logical. Detect NULL TRUE. Default: TRUE. include_empty_str Logical. Detect "" TRUE. Default: TRUE. return_names Logical. TRUE (default), return column names; else logical vector.

title: ğŸ§­ cols_with_void(): Detect Columns Containing Void Values â€” cols_with_void
text: character vector (column names) logical vector indicating void presence per column.

title: ğŸ§­ cols_with_void(): Detect Columns Containing Void Values â€” cols_with_void
code: df <- data.frame(name = c("A", "", "C"), score = c(1, NA, 3), id = 1:3) cols_with_void(df) #> [1] "name"  "score" cols_with_void(df, return_names = FALSE) #>  name score    id  #>  TRUE  TRUE FALSE

what: ğŸ§® Combine multiple logical vectors with a logical operator â€” combine_logic
title: ğŸ§® Combine multiple logical vectors with a logical operator â€” combine_logic
text: utility function combine two logical vectors using logical (&) (|) operations. Supports NA handling checks consistent vector lengths.

title: ğŸ§® Combine multiple logical vectors with a logical operator â€” combine_logic
code: combine_logic(..., op = "&", na.rm = FALSE)

title: ğŸ§® Combine multiple logical vectors with a logical operator â€” combine_logic
text: ... Logical vectors combine. op Operator apply: "&" (default) "|". na.rm Logical. TRUE, treats NA values TRUE (default FALSE).

title: ğŸ§® Combine multiple logical vectors with a logical operator â€” combine_logic
text: single logical vector length inputs.

title: ğŸ§® Combine multiple logical vectors with a logical operator â€” combine_logic
code: x <- 1:5 combine_logic(x > 2, x %% 2 == 1)            # AND by default #> [1] FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE combine_logic(x > 2, x %% 2 == 1, op = "|")  # OR logic #> [1]  TRUE FALSE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE combine_logic(c(TRUE, NA), c(TRUE, TRUE), na.rm = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE TRUE

what: ğŸ”„ compile_palettes(): Compile JSON palettes into RDS â€” compile_palettes
title: ğŸ”„ compile_palettes(): Compile JSON palettes into RDS â€” compile_palettes
text: Read JSON files palettes_dir/, validate content, compile structured RDS file.

title: ğŸ”„ compile_palettes(): Compile JSON palettes into RDS â€” compile_palettes
code: compile_palettes(   palettes_dir = "inst/extdata/palettes",   output_rds = "data/palettes.rds",   log = TRUE )

title: ğŸ”„ compile_palettes(): Compile JSON palettes into RDS â€” compile_palettes
text: palettes_dir Folder containing subdirs: sequential/, diverging/, qualitative/ output_rds Path save compiled RDS file. Default: "data/palettes.rds" log Whether log compilation events. Default: TRUE

title: ğŸ”„ compile_palettes(): Compile JSON palettes into RDS â€” compile_palettes
text: Invisibly returns RDS file path (character)

what: ğŸ¨ create_palette(): Save Custom Color Palettes as JSON â€” create_palette
title: ğŸ¨ create_palette(): Save Custom Color Palettes as JSON â€” create_palette
text: Save named color palette (sequential, diverging, qualitative) JSON file. Used palette sharing, reuse, future compilation.

title: ğŸ¨ create_palette(): Save Custom Color Palettes as JSON â€” create_palette
code: create_palette(   name,   type = c("sequential", "diverging", "qualitative"),   colors,   color_dir = "inst/extdata/palettes",   log = TRUE )

title: ğŸ¨ create_palette(): Save Custom Color Palettes as JSON â€” create_palette
text: name Character. Palette name (e.g., "Blues"). type Character. One "sequential", "diverging", "qualitative". colors Character vector HEX color values (e.g., "#E64B35" "#E64B35B2"). color_dir Root folder store palettes (default: "inst/extdata/palettes"). log Logical. Whether log palette creation "logs/palettes/create_palette.log".

title: ğŸ¨ create_palette(): Save Custom Color Palettes as JSON â€” create_palette
text: (Invisibly) list path info.

title: ğŸ¨ create_palette(): Save Custom Color Palettes as JSON â€” create_palette
code: create_palette("blues", "sequential", c("#deebf7", "#9ecae1", "#3182bd")) #> ! âš ï¸ Palette already exists: inst/extdata/palettes/sequential/blues.json create_palette("vividset", "qualitative", c("#E64B35", "#4DBBD5", "#00A087")) #> ! âš ï¸ Palette already exists: inst/extdata/palettes/qualitative/vividset.json

what: ğŸ“¦ Convert Data Frame to Named List by Grouping â€” df2list
title: ğŸ“¦ Convert Data Frame to Named List by Grouping â€” df2list
text: Group data frame one column convert named list. key becomes list name; value column becomes vector.

title: ğŸ“¦ Convert Data Frame to Named List by Grouping â€” df2list
code: df2list(data, key_col, value_col, verbose = TRUE)

title: ğŸ“¦ Convert Data Frame to Named List by Grouping â€” df2list
text: data data.frame tibble grouped. key_col Character. Column name list names. value_col Character. Column name list values. verbose Logical. Whether show message. Default = TRUE.

title: ğŸ“¦ Convert Data Frame to Named List by Grouping â€” df2list
text: named list, element character vector values.

title: ğŸ“¦ Convert Data Frame to Named List by Grouping â€” df2list
code: df <- data.frame(   cell_type = c("T_cells", "T_cells", "B_cells", "B_cells"),   marker = c("CD3D", "CD3E", "CD79A", "MS4A1") ) df2list(df, "cell_type", "marker") #> âœ” ğŸ¯ Converted 2 groups into a named list. #> $B_cells #> [1] "CD79A" "MS4A1" #>  #> $T_cells #> [1] "CD3D" "CD3E" #>

what: ğŸ§¼ drop_void(): Remove Void Values from a Vector or List â€” drop_void
title: ğŸ§¼ drop_void(): Remove Void Values from a Vector or List â€” drop_void
text: Remove elements vector list considered "void": NA, NULL, empty strings (""). can toggled via parameters.

title: ğŸ§¼ drop_void(): Remove Void Values from a Vector or List â€” drop_void
code: drop_void(x, include_na = TRUE, include_null = TRUE, include_empty_str = TRUE)

title: ğŸ§¼ drop_void(): Remove Void Values from a Vector or List â€” drop_void
text: x vector list. include_na Logical. Remove NA TRUE. Default: TRUE. include_null Logical. Remove NULL TRUE. Default: TRUE. include_empty_str Logical. Remove "" TRUE. Default: TRUE.

title: ğŸ§¼ drop_void(): Remove Void Values from a Vector or List â€” drop_void
text: cleaned vector list type input, void values removed.

title: ğŸ§¼ drop_void(): Remove Void Values from a Vector or List â€” drop_void
code: drop_void(c("apple", "", NA, "banana")) #> [1] "apple"  "banana" drop_void(list("A", NA, "", NULL, "B")) #> [[1]] #> [1] "A" #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] "B" #>  drop_void(c("", NA), include_na = FALSE) #> [1] NA

what: evanverse: A Utility Toolkit for Everyday R Development âš™ï¸ğŸ“¦ â€” evanverse
title: evanverse: A Utility Toolkit for Everyday R Development âš™ï¸ğŸ“¦ â€” evanverse
text: evanverse package offers lightweight modular collection functions, tailored support efficient reproducible R workflows research analysis.

title: evanverse: A Utility Toolkit for Everyday R Development âš™ï¸ğŸ“¦ â€” evanverse
text: provides tools : Logical operations ğŸ” Package installation management ğŸ“¦ Color formatting visualization support ğŸ¨ Workflow automation utilities ğŸ› ï¸ Clean wrappers common scripting tasks evanverse framework, personal, evolving toolbox â€” pragmatically built, cleanly organized, continuously maintained everyday scientific computing. Ideal researchers, developers, anyone values simplicity clarity. âœ¨

title: evanverse: A Utility Toolkit for Everyday R Development âš™ï¸ğŸ“¦ â€” evanverse

what: ğŸ“¥ ev_download(): Download a file from URL (supports FTP/HTTP + unzip) â€” ev_download
title: ğŸ“¥ ev_download(): Download a file from URL (supports FTP/HTTP + unzip) â€” ev_download
text: robust friendly downloader supports FTP/HTTP/HTTPS sources. Automatically skips download file already exists.

title: ğŸ“¥ ev_download(): Download a file from URL (supports FTP/HTTP + unzip) â€” ev_download
code: ev_download(   url,   dest = basename(url),   method = "auto",   overwrite = FALSE,   unzip = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: ğŸ“¥ ev_download(): Download a file from URL (supports FTP/HTTP + unzip) â€” ev_download
text: url Character. Full URL file (FTP HTTP). dest Character. Path save file (default: basename(url)). method Character. One "auto", "curl", "wget", "internal". Default: "auto". overwrite Logical. Overwrite file exists. Default: FALSE. unzip Logical. Whether unzip download. Default: FALSE. verbose Logical. Show progress messages. Default: TRUE.

title: ğŸ“¥ ev_download(): Download a file from URL (supports FTP/HTTP + unzip) â€” ev_download
text: Invisibly returns path(s) downloaded (optionally unzipped) file(s).

what: ğŸ“„ Summarize File Information (size, time, line count) â€” file_info
title: ğŸ“„ Summarize File Information (size, time, line count) â€” file_info
text: Given file folder path (vector), returns data.frame containing file name, size (MB), last modified time, optional line count, path.

title: ğŸ“„ Summarize File Information (size, time, line count) â€” file_info
code: file_info(   paths,   recursive = FALSE,   count_line = TRUE,   preview = TRUE,   filter_pattern = NULL,   full_name = TRUE )

title: ğŸ“„ Summarize File Information (size, time, line count) â€” file_info
text: paths Character vector file paths folder path. recursive Logical. folder given, whether search recursively. count_line Logical. Whether count lines file. Default: TRUE. preview Logical. Whether show skipped/missing messages. Default: TRUE. filter_pattern Optional regex filter file names (e.g., "\.R$"). full_name Logical. Whether return full file paths. Default: TRUE.

title: ğŸ“„ Summarize File Information (size, time, line count) â€” file_info
text: data.frame file, size_MB, modified_time, line_count, path.

title: ğŸ“„ Summarize File Information (size, time, line count) â€” file_info
code: file_info("R") #> ! No valid files found. #> data frame with 0 columns and 0 rows file_info(c("README.md", "DESCRIPTION")) #> ! No valid files found. #> data frame with 0 columns and 0 rows file_info("R", filter_pattern = "\\.R$", recursive = TRUE) #> ! No valid files found. #> data frame with 0 columns and 0 rows

what: ğŸŒ² Print and Log Directory Tree Structure â€” file_tree
title: ğŸŒ² Print and Log Directory Tree Structure â€” file_tree
text: Print directory structure given path tree-like format. Optionally, save result log file record keeping debugging.

title: ğŸŒ² Print and Log Directory Tree Structure â€” file_tree
code: file_tree(   path = ".",   max_depth = 2,   log = FALSE,   log_path = "logs/tree",   file_name = NULL,   append = FALSE )

title: ğŸŒ² Print and Log Directory Tree Structure â€” file_tree
text: path Character. target root directory path print. Default ".". max_depth Integer. Maximum depth recursion subdirectories. Default 2. log Logical. Whether save tree output log file. Default FALSE. log_path Character. Directory path save log file log = TRUE. Default "logs/tree". file_name Character. Custom file name log file. NULL, name like "file_tree_YYYYMMDD_HHMMSS.log" used. append Logical. TRUE, appends existing file (present). FALSE, overwrites file. Default FALSE.

title: ğŸŒ² Print and Log Directory Tree Structure â€” file_tree
text: Invisibly returns character vector containing line file tree.

title: ğŸŒ² Print and Log Directory Tree Structure â€” file_tree
code: file_tree() #>  #> â”€â”€ ğŸ“‚ Directory Tree: F:\Projects\evanverse\docs\reference â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ #> â”œâ”€â”€ any_void.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ bio_palette_gallery.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ check_pkg.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ cols_with_void.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ combine_logic.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ compile_palettes.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ create_palette.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ df2list.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ drop_void.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ ev_download.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ evanverse-package.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ evanverse.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ file_info.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ file_tree.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ get_ext.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ get_palette.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ gmt2df.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ gmt2list.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ grapes-is-grapes.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ grapes-nin-grapes.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ grapes-p-grapes.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ hex2rgb.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ index.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ inst  #> â”‚   â””â”€â”€ extdata  #> â”œâ”€â”€ inst_pkg.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ is_void.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ list_palettes.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ logs  #> â”‚   â””â”€â”€ palettes  #> â”œâ”€â”€ pkg_version.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ plot_pie.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ plot_venn-1.png  #> â”œâ”€â”€ plot_venn-2.png  #> â”œâ”€â”€ plot_venn-3.png  #> â”œâ”€â”€ plot_venn-4.png  #> â”œâ”€â”€ plot_venn-5.png  #> â”œâ”€â”€ plot_venn.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ preview_palette.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ remind.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ replace_void.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ rgb2hex.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ rows_with_void.html  #> â”œâ”€â”€ update_pkg.html  #> â””â”€â”€ with_timer.html  file_tree("data", max_depth = 3, log = TRUE) #> âœ– âŒ Directory does not exist: F:\Projects\evanverse\docs\reference\data

what: ğŸ§¾ Get File Extension(s) â€” get_ext
title: ğŸ§¾ Get File Extension(s) â€” get_ext
text: Extract file extension(s) file name path. Supports vector input optionally preserves compound extensions (e.g., .tar.gz) keep_all = TRUE.

title: ğŸ§¾ Get File Extension(s) â€” get_ext
code: get_ext(paths, keep_all = FALSE)

title: ğŸ§¾ Get File Extension(s) â€” get_ext
text: paths character vector file names paths. keep_all Logical. TRUE, returns full suffix first dot basename (e.g., "tar.gz"); otherwise returns last extension. Default: FALSE.

title: ğŸ§¾ Get File Extension(s) â€” get_ext
text: character vector extensions (leading dots).

title: ğŸ§¾ Get File Extension(s) â€” get_ext
code: get_ext("data.csv")               # "csv" #> [1] "csv" get_ext("archive.tar.gz")        # "gz" #> [1] "gz" get_ext("archive.tar.gz", TRUE)  # "tar.gz" #> [1] "tar.gz" get_ext(c("a.R", "b.txt", "c"))   # "R" "txt" "" #> [1] "R"   "txt" ""

what: ğŸ¨ get_palette(): Load Color Palette from RDS â€” get_palette
title: ğŸ¨ get_palette(): Load Color Palette from RDS â€” get_palette
text: Load named palette data/palettes.rds, returning vector HEX colors. Automatically checks type mismatch gives smart suggestions.

title: ğŸ¨ get_palette(): Load Color Palette from RDS â€” get_palette
code: get_palette(   name,   type = c("sequential", "diverging", "qualitative"),   n = NULL,   palette_rds = here::here("data/palettes.rds") )

title: ğŸ¨ get_palette(): Load Color Palette from RDS â€” get_palette
text: name Name palette (e.g. "vividset"). type One : "sequential", "diverging", "qualitative". n Number colors return. Default NULL returns . palette_rds Path RDS file. Default: ::("data/palettes.rds").

title: ğŸ¨ get_palette(): Load Color Palette from RDS â€” get_palette
text: character vector HEX color codes.

title: ğŸ¨ get_palette(): Load Color Palette from RDS â€” get_palette
code: get_palette("vividset", type = "qualitative") #> âœ” Loaded palette 'vividset' (qualitative), 9 colors. #> [1] "#E64B35" "#4DBBD5" "#00A087" "#3C5488" "#F39B7F" "#8491B4" "#91D1C2" #> [8] "#DC0000" "#7E6148" get_palette("softtrio", type = "qualitative", n = 2) #> âœ” Loaded palette 'softtrio' (qualitative), 3 colors. #> [1] "#E64B35B2" "#00A087B2"

what: ğŸ“„ Convert GMT File to Long-format Data Frame â€” gmt2df
title: ğŸ“„ Convert GMT File to Long-format Data Frame â€” gmt2df
text: Reads .gmt gene set file returns long-format data frame one row per gene, including gene set name optional description.

what: Strict identity comparison with diagnostics â€” %is%
title: Strict identity comparison with diagnostics â€” %is%
text: semantic operator checks whether two objects strictly identical, prints differ .

title: Strict identity comparison with diagnostics â€” %is%
code: a %is% b

title: Strict identity comparison with diagnostics â€” %is%
text: First object (vector, matrix, data.frame) b Second object (vector, matrix, data.frame)

title: Strict identity comparison with diagnostics â€” %is%
text: TRUE identical, FALSE otherwise (diagnostics)

title: Strict identity comparison with diagnostics â€” %is%
code: 1:3 %is% 1:3          # TRUE #> [1] TRUE 1:3 %is% c(1, 2, 3)   # FALSE, type mismatch #> â”€â”€ âŒ Objects are NOT identical â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ #> âœ– Type mismatch: "integer" vs "double" #> âœ– Class mismatch: "integer" vs "numeric" #> [1] FALSE data.frame(x=1) %is% data.frame(y=1)  # FALSE, name mismatch #> â”€â”€ âŒ Objects are NOT identical â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ #> âœ– Column names differ: "x" vs "y" #> âœ– Values are not identical. #> [1] FALSE

title: âŒ %nin%: Not In Operator â€” %nin%
code: c("A", "B", "C") %nin% c("B", "D")  # TRUE FALSE TRUE #> [1]  TRUE FALSE  TRUE 1:5 %nin% c(2, 4)                   # TRUE FALSE TRUE FALSE TRUE #> [1]  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE

code: pkg_version(c("ggplot2", "limma", "MRPRESSO", "nonexistentpackage123")) #>  #> â”€â”€ Fetching installed R packages... â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ #>  #> â”€â”€ Fetching CRAN package database... â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ #>  #> â”€â”€ Fetching Bioconductor package database... â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ #> 'getOption("repos")' replaces Bioconductor standard repositories, see #> 'help("repositories", package = "BiocManager")' for details. #> Replacement repositories: #>     CRAN: https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/CRAN/ #>  #> â”€â”€ Checking package: ggplot2 â”€â”€ #>  #> âœ” Found on CRAN: 3.5.2 #>  #> â”€â”€ Checking package: limma â”€â”€ #>  #> âœ” Found on Bioconductor: 3.64.0 #>  #> â”€â”€ Checking package: MRPRESSO â”€â”€ #>  #> âœ” Found on GitHub: GitHub (rondolab/MR-PRESSO@HEAD) (SHA: 3e3c92d) #>  #> â”€â”€ Checking package: nonexistentpackage123 â”€â”€ #>  #> ! Not found in CRAN, Bioconductor, or GitHub. #>                 package version  latest                           source #> 1               ggplot2   3.5.2   3.5.2                             CRAN #> 2                 limma  3.64.0  3.64.0                     Bioconductor #> 3              MRPRESSO     1.0 3e3c92d GitHub (rondolab/MR-PRESSO@HEAD) #> 4 nonexistentpackage123    <NA>    <NA>                        Not Found

what: ğŸ¥§ Plot a Clean Pie Chart with Optional Inner Labels â€” plot_pie
title: ğŸ¥§ Plot a Clean Pie Chart with Optional Inner Labels â€” plot_pie
text: Generate polished pie chart vector grouped data frame. Labels (optional) placed inside pie slices.

title: ğŸ¥§ Plot a Clean Pie Chart with Optional Inner Labels â€” plot_pie
code: plot_pie(   data,   group_col = "group",   count_col = "count",   label = c("none", "count", "percent", "both"),   label_size = 4,   label_color = "black",   fill = c("#009076", "#C71E1D", "#15607A", "#FA8C00", "#18A1CD"),   title = "Pie Chart",   title_size = 14,   title_color = "black",   legend.position = "right",   preview = TRUE,   save = NULL,   return_data = FALSE )

title: ğŸ¥§ Plot a Clean Pie Chart with Optional Inner Labels â€” plot_pie
text: data character/factor vector data.frame. group_col Group column name (data.frame). Default: "group". count_col Count column name (data.frame). Default: "count". label Type label display: "none", "count", "percent", "". Default: "none". label_size Label font size. Default: 4. label_color Label font color. Default: "black". fill Fill color vector. Default: 5-color palette. title Plot title. Default: "Pie Chart". title_size Title font size. Default: 14. title_color Title color. Default: "black". legend.position Legend position. Default: "right". preview Whether print plot. Default: TRUE. save Optional path save plot (e.g., "plot.png"). return_data TRUE, return list(plot = ..., data = ...). Default: FALSE.

title: ğŸ¥§ Plot a Clean Pie Chart with Optional Inner Labels â€” plot_pie
text: ggplot object list(plot, data)

what: ğŸ¨ Draw Venn Diagrams (2â€“4 sets, classic or gradient style) â€” plot_venn
title: ğŸ¨ Draw Venn Diagrams (2â€“4 sets, classic or gradient style) â€” plot_venn
text: flexible unified Venn diagram plotting function supporting ggvenn ggVennDiagram. Automatically handles naming, de-duplication, visualization.

title: ğŸ¨ Draw Venn Diagrams (2â€“4 sets, classic or gradient style) â€” plot_venn
code: plot_venn(   set1,   set2,   set3 = NULL,   set4 = NULL,   category.names = NULL,   fill = c("skyblue", "pink", "lightgreen", "lightyellow"),   label = "count",   label_geom = "label",   label_alpha = 0,   fill_alpha = 0.5,   label_size = 4,   label_color = "black",   set_color = "black",   set_size = 5,   edge_lty = "solid",   edge_size = 0.8,   title = "My Venn Diagram",   title_size = 14,   title_color = "#F06292",   legend.position = "none",   method = c("classic", "gradient"),   digits = 1,   label_sep = ",",   show_outside = "auto",   auto_scale = FALSE,   palette = "Spectral",   direction = 1,   preview = TRUE,   return_sets = FALSE,   ... )

title: ğŸ¨ Draw Venn Diagrams (2â€“4 sets, classic or gradient style) â€” plot_venn
text: set1, set2, set3, set4 Input vectors. least two sets required. category.names Optional vector set names. NULL, variable names used. fill Fill colors (method = "classic"). label Label type: "count", "percent", "", "none". label_geom Label geometry ggVennDiagram: "label" "text". label_alpha Background transparency labels (gradient). fill_alpha Transparency filled regions (classic). label_size Size region labels. label_color Color region labels. set_color Color set labels borders. set_size Font size set names. edge_lty Line type borders. edge_size Border thickness. title Plot title. title_size Title font size. title_color Title font color. legend.position Legend position. Default: "none". method Drawing method: "classic" (ggvenn) "gradient" (ggVennDiagram). digits Decimal places percentages (classic ). label_sep Separator overlapping elements (classic ). show_outside Show outside elements (classic ). auto_scale Whether auto-scale layout (classic ). palette Gradient palette name (gradient ). direction Palette direction (gradient ). preview Whether print plot screen. return_sets TRUE, returns list de-duplicated input sets. ... Additional arguments passed underlying plot function.

title: ğŸ¨ Draw Venn Diagrams (2â€“4 sets, classic or gradient style) â€” plot_venn
text: ggplot object (optionally list processed sets return_sets = TRUE).

title: ğŸ¨ Draw Venn Diagrams (2â€“4 sets, classic or gradient style) â€” plot_venn
code: set.seed(123) g1 <- sample(letters, 15) g2 <- sample(letters, 10) g3 <- sample(letters, 12)  # Classic 3-set Venn plot_venn(g1, g2, g3, method = "classic", title = "Classic Venn")    # Gradient 2-set Venn plot_venn(g1, g2, method = "gradient", title = "Gradient Venn")    # Return sets for downstream use out <- plot_venn(g1, g2, return_sets = TRUE)  names(out) #> [1] "plot" "sets"

text: HEX color string single RGB vector provided, character vector HEX codes list RGB values provided.

title: ğŸ¨ Convert RGB values to HEX color codes â€” rgb2hex
code: # Convert single RGB value rgb2hex(c(255, 128, 0))  # "#FF8000" #> âœ” RGB: c(255, 128, 0) â†’ HEX: #FF8000 #> [1] "#FF8000"  # Convert multiple RGB values rgb2hex(list(c(255, 128, 0), c(0, 255, 0)))  # c("#FF8000", "#00FF00") #> âœ” Converted 2 RGB value(s) to HEX: #> â„¹ RGB: c(255, 128, 0) â†’ HEX: #FF8000 #> â„¹ RGB: c(0, 255, 0) â†’ HEX: #00FF00 #> [1] "#FF8000" "#00FF00"

what: ğŸ§­ rows_with_void(): Detect Rows Containing Void Values (NA / NULL /
title: ğŸ§­ rows_with_void(): Detect Rows Containing Void Values (NA / NULL /
text: Scan data.frame tibble identify rows contain "void" values. Void values include NA, NULL, empty strings (""), can toggled via parameters.

title: ğŸ§­ rows_with_void(): Detect Rows Containing Void Values (NA / NULL /
code: rows_with_void(   data,   include_na = TRUE,   include_null = TRUE,   include_empty_str = TRUE )

title: ğŸ§­ rows_with_void(): Detect Rows Containing Void Values (NA / NULL /
text: data data.frame tibble. include_na Logical. Detect NA TRUE. Default: TRUE. include_null Logical. Detect NULL TRUE. Default: TRUE. include_empty_str Logical. Detect "" TRUE. Default: TRUE.

title: ğŸ§­ rows_with_void(): Detect Rows Containing Void Values (NA / NULL /
text: logical vector indicating row contains void values.

title: ğŸ§­ rows_with_void(): Detect Rows Containing Void Values (NA / NULL /
code: df <- data.frame(id = 1:3, name = c("A", "", "C"), score = c(10, NA, 20)) rows_with_void(df) #> [1] FALSE  TRUE FALSE df[rows_with_void(df), ] #>   id name score #> 2  2         NA

what: ğŸ”„ Update R Packages from CRAN, GitHub, or Bioconductor â€” update_pkg
title: ğŸ”„ Update R Packages from CRAN, GitHub, or Bioconductor â€” update_pkg
text: unified function update R packages source. Supports full updates, source-specific updates, targeted package updates. Automatically sets mirrors (Tsinghua CRAN, Tsinghua Bioconductor) handles version compatibility checks. Ensures Bioconductor installations specify correct version avoid mismatches.

title: ğŸ”„ Update R Packages from CRAN, GitHub, or Bioconductor â€” update_pkg
code: update_pkg(pkg = NULL, source = NULL)

title: ğŸ”„ Update R Packages from CRAN, GitHub, or Bioconductor â€” update_pkg
text: pkg Character vector. Name(s) package(s) update. GitHub, use "user/repo" format. required source specified. source Character. source package(s): "CRAN", "GitHub" ("gh"), "Bioconductor" ("bio"). Optional updating installed CRAN Bioconductor packages.

title: ğŸ”„ Update R Packages from CRAN, GitHub, or Bioconductor â€” update_pkg
text: Invisible NULL. Outputs update progress logs via message().

what: â±ï¸ Wrap a function to measure and display execution time â€” with_timer
title: â±ï¸ Wrap a function to measure and display execution time â€” with_timer
text: utility wraps function CLI-based timing displays runtime seconds. especially useful benchmarking logging time-consuming tasks.

title: â±ï¸ Wrap a function to measure and display execution time â€” with_timer
code: with_timer(fn, name = "Task")

title: â±ï¸ Wrap a function to measure and display execution time â€” with_timer
text: fn function wrapped name short descriptive name task (used log output)

title: â±ï¸ Wrap a function to measure and display execution time â€” with_timer
text: new function executes fn(...) prints timing information

title: â±ï¸ Wrap a function to measure and display execution time â€” with_timer
text: function requires cli tictoc packages.

title: â±ï¸ Wrap a function to measure and display execution time â€” with_timer
code: slow_fn <- function(n) { Sys.sleep(0.2); n^2 } timed_fn <- with_timer(slow_fn, name = "Square Task") timed_fn(5) #>  #> â”€â”€ Square Task started at 2025-04-22 16:59:11.681396 â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ #> âœ” Square Task completed in "0.200" seconds
